p: One birnavirus was identified in a filter-feeding insect, Isonychia kiangsinensis. The genome of Isonychia kiangsinensis birna-like virus comprised two segments, of which the polymerase-encoded segment best matched the Drosophila X virus (42.8% aa identity). The birnavirus was divided into three evolutionary lineages ( Fig.Â S5); one was associated with vertebrate animals, and the other two were associated with invertebrate animals (mostly insects). Hence, a genetically diverse population of birnaviruses might be present in insects and other invertebrate animals.
